text: Fujiwara no Asatada, from the Ogura Hyakunin Isshu. Fujiwara no Asatada (Japanese: 藤原 朝忠, also 中納言朝忠, Chunagon Asatada) (910 – January 19, 966) was a middle Heian waka and Japanese nobleman. He was designated a member of the Thirty-six Poetry Immortals and one of his poems is included in the famous anthology Hyakunin Isshu. Asatada's poems are included in official poetry anthologies from the Gosen Wakashū onward. A personal collection known as the Asatadashū also remains. ==External links== *E-text of his poems in Japanese Category:910 births Category:966 deaths Category:Japanese male poets Category:Fujiwara clan Category:10th-century Japanese poets Category:Hyakunin Isshu poets
title: Fujiwara no Asatada
